title: Davis arrested in Miami after two-week search
content: Gervonta Davis was taken into custody Wednesday on an arrest warrant on charges of battery, false imprisonment and attempted kidnapping.

title: Chargers hire Western Michigan's O'Leary as DC
content: Western Michigan defensive coordinator Chris O'Leary, who was the Chargers' safeties coach in 2024, returns to Los Angeles to be the team's defensive coordinator.

title: LeBron tears up during Cavaliers' tribute video
content: LeBron James was moved to tears during a video tribute by the Cavaliers, saying that while he hasn't made a decision about his future, Wednesday night's game "very well could" have been his final one in Cleveland.

title: Tatum waiting to make call on a return this season...
content: Celtics All-Star forward Jayson Tatum told ESPN he hasn't made a decision about whether he will return from a torn Achilles tendon this season because he "wants to get it right the first time."

title: Rybakina thwarts Pegula comeback, reaches final
content: Elena Rybakina set up a rematch of the 2023 Australian Open final after the No. 5 seed ousted No. 6 Jessica Pegula 6-3, 7-6 (7) in a semifinal that was mostly one way until Rybakina had match point.

title: Sabalenka bests Svitolina, on to 4th Aussie final
content: Aryna Sabalenka overpowered Elina Svitolina 6-2, 6-3 to move within one victory of a third Australian Open title in four years.

title: Jason Williams' rookie jersey sells for $140K
content: Jason Williams' game-worn home white Sacramento Kings jersey from the lockout-shortened 1998-99 NBA season, Williams' rookie year, has sold privately for $140,000. It's the most spent on any Williams item.

title: Sources: Giannis preps for Bucks exit amid offers
content: The Knicks, Heat, Timberwolves and Warriors are among teams making offers for the Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo ahead of the trade deadline, sources told ESPN.

title: Ranking NFL head coaching hires of the past five o...
content: Who were the best -- and worst -- coaching hires since 2021? And how do the Super Bowl coaches stack up? We ranked all 37 moves.

title: Copy of Browns hire Todd Monken as head coach: Who is he a...
content: Cleveland tabs the former Ravens OC to become the franchise's 11th coach since 1999. Here's what we know.

title: Ranking all 30 MLB farm systems: Which team is the...
content: How bright is your favorite club's future? Here's how every organization stacks up entering the 2026 season.

title: A Giannis trade, Jimmy Butler's future and the big...
content: Can the Warriors make a deal for Giannis Antetokounmpo? The biggest questions one week out from the deadline.

title: What 29 NBA teams can offer for Giannis -- and why...
content: Which teams have the players, draft picks and contracts to get a deal done for Giannis Antetokounmpo?

title: Our updated NFL free agent 1-50 ranking, six weeks...
content: Could George Pickens, Breece Hall and Malik Willis land big contracts? Here are the top 50 free agents heading into the offseason.

title: Biggest looming free agent decisions for every tea...
content: NFL free agency starts on March 11. What does the future look like for these 32 soon-to-be free agents?

title: When is WWE Royal Rumble 2026? How to watch on ESP...
content: It's time for WWE Royal Rumble 2026! Check out how to watch the action from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, on ESPN.

title: Gold or bust? X factors for all 12 men's Olympic h...
content: Who's going to win at the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics? How these specific players perform could make the difference.

title: Why the Wizards don't need Trae Young to be a fran...
content: The four-time All-Star wasn't brought in to be a franchise savior, the Wizards say. He was brought in to cultivate the player they believe is their next one, former No. 2 pick Alex Sarr.

title: Champions League talking points: Mourinho's master...
content: With all 36 Champions League teams in action simultaneously, Matchday 8 of the league phase delivered plenty of drama to cap a fun competition so far. ESPN FC's writers pick out their highs and lows of the tournament to this point.

title: Copy of Ranked: Who are the top 50 players in the Premier ...
content: The Premier League Top 50 returns for 2026 to rank the best players in the Premier League so far this season.

title: Copy of Why each Australian Open men's semifinalist can wi...
content: And then there were four: Carlos Alcaraz, Jannik Sinner, Alexander Zverev and Novak Djokovic. Here's how each can win the Australian Open.

title: Ranking the top 50 men's college basketball players: Cameron Boozer, then who?
content: No. 1 and 2 were not up for debate. The rest? Fair game. See who made the cut based on performances so far.

title: Women's Bracketology: How a new metric will help (...
content: Understanding wins above bubble helps explain why Virginia, which has a 37 NET ranking, is on the outside looking in.

title: Best of Day 2 at the Senior Bowl: Cole Payton stan...
content: Here are the top NFL draft risers from the second day of Senior Bowl practices, including an FCS QB who is making a statement.

title: Four ways a new CBA can get done
content: The 2026 season is just over 100 days away, but negotiations between the WNBA and players' union are at a stalemate.

title: 'The dominoes are starting to fall': Brooks Koepka...
content: Koepka's return this week at Torrey Pines and the news that Patrick Reed is also coming back gave the PGA Tour momentum as 2026 gets underway.

title: How to bet the Farmers Insurance Open: English, Ma...
content: The third stop of the PGA Tour brings us to San Diego, where scoring could be hard to come by at Torrey Pines.

title: Copy of Copy of Transfer rumors, news: Sterling 'willing to play a...
content: Raheem Sterling is willing to consider "all options" as he seeks a new permanent club after leaving Chelsea this week. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: What to expect from Murakami, Okamoto, Imai and more
content: Todd Zola dives into the statistics to tell us what exactly we should expect from some of the players coming to MLB in 2026 from overseas.

title: UFC 325 picks: Experts split on Volkanovski-Lopes ...
content: Alexander Volkanovski beat Diego Lopes to reclaim UFC gold in April, but don't expect a one-sided rematch

title: 'Bulldoze these guys': Alexander Volkanovski's vow...
content: A lot has changed since his last fight, but a late-career lingering UFC narrative remains a constant.

title: Lopez-Stevenson picks: Can power crack Shakur's de...
content: Will Teofimo Lopez Jr. solve Shakur Stevenson's defense and impose his offense? Or will Stevenson control the range, neutralizing Lopez's power?

title: Ranking this weekend's fights: From Lopez-Shakur t...
content: Nick Parkinson ranks the weekend's fights from best to worst and breaks down what's at stake in each matchup.

title: Betting buzz: Mattress Mack makes largest Super Bo...
content: Known for extravagant bets, the Houston furniture salesman has $2 million on the Patriots to win the Super Bowl.

title: Seven bets to make on Drake Maye and Sam Darnold i...
content: Matt Bowen breaks down the QBs and offers his best bets on Drake Maye and Sam Darnold in the Super Bowl.

title: 'Rich military heritage on display': PM Modi attends Beating Retreat 2026
content: The Beating Retreat ceremony will formally conclude Republic Day celebrations today. This event showcases India's military heritage and the armed forces' dedication. Bands from the Army, Navy, and Air Force will perform at Vijay Chowk. Traffic restrictions are in place in central Delhi to ensure the ceremony proceeds smoothly. Commuters are advised to use alternative routes.

title: Big AI push: PM Modi meets CEOs of top firms; lays out roadplan, flags pitfalls
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged with Indian AI leaders, emphasising ethical use, data security, and indigenous solutions for national growth. He highlighted India's digital prowess, citing UPI as a model for AI development. The interaction aimed to foster collaborations and accelerate India's AI mission, with industry leaders backing self-reliance goals.

title: Peter Thiel to Europe: You can never have a Google, Microsoft, or Amazon
content: Billionaire Peter Thiel argues European tech founders are too risk-averse, cashing out early instead of pursuing global scale. He contrasts this with Silicon Valley's embrace of failure, citing Mark Zuckerberg's rejection of a $1 billion Facebook offer.  Venture capital data shows the US significantly outpaces Europe in funding and large investment funds, highlighting a persistent gap.

title: 'Our captain needs to attend to his oven': Iceland Cricket puts PCB on ice with World Cup satire
content: Iceland Cricket humorously declined a hypothetical offer to replace Pakistan in the T20 World Cup, citing player commitments like baking and banking. They playfully jabbed at other nations and suggested Uganda might benefit from Pakistan's potential withdrawal. The Pakistan Cricket Board is expected to finalize its tournament plans soon.

title: 'They don't have guts': Ajinkya Rahane mocks Pak over T20 World Cup boycott threat
content: Pakistan's participation in the T20 World Cup 2026 is uncertain. The Pakistan Cricket Board may withdraw in protest of Bangladesh's exclusion.  The ICC has warned Pakistan of severe disciplinary actions if they fail to participate.  Former Indian captain Ajinkya Rahane expressed skepticism about Pakistan's boycott threat.  The final decision rests with the Pakistani government.

title: Read Amazon’s email to 16,000 laid-off staff after company-wide review
content: Amazon has initiated a new wave of corporate layoffs, impacting approximately 16,000 roles across the US, UK, and India. Senior Vice President Beth Galetti informed affected employees via email about the difficult decision, citing a thorough organizational review. The company is providing support measures including severance, 90 days of full pay and benefits, and job placement assistance.

title: OPS says ready for AIADMK reunion - what's behind his desperate pitch
content: Expelled AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam has publicly expressed readiness for reunification with Edappadi Palaniswami's faction ahead of the 2026 Tamil Nadu polls. Despite OPS's overture, EPS has firmly rejected any possibility of his return, citing past expulsion. This move highlights OPS's political isolation and a desperate bid for relevance.

title: Baramati plane crash: Wristwatch, sitting position help cops identify Ajit Pawar’s body
content: Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's body was identified after a Learjet 45 aircraft crashed near Baramati. Police used his wristwatch and familiar seating position to confirm his identity. The aircraft departed Mumbai and was on final approach to Baramati when the incident occurred. Pilots reported runway visibility issues before the crash.

title: SC stays UGC equity regulations: Timeline of protests, politics and court’s intervention
content: The Supreme Court has halted new UGC Equity Regulations 2026. The court cited vagueness in the rules, which had sparked protests and legal challenges. Existing 2012 regulations will remain in effect. The Supreme Court will hear the matter again on March 19. This decision impacts how discrimination is addressed in Indian higher education institutions.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX may be looking for auspicious date around Guru-Shukra Yuti for IPO
content: Elon Musk is reportedly planning SpaceX's public debut in mid-June 2026, coinciding with a rare Jupiter-Venus celestial alignment. This move, aimed at raising up to $50 billion at a $1.5 trillion valuation, is purportedly to fund Starship development and space-based data centers. The timing also aligns with Musk's 55th birthday.

title: Censor certificate legal battle: Vijay film makers withdraw case; release timeline may shift
content: The makers of Thalapathy Vijay's film Jana Nayagan are withdrawing their case for a censor certificate. This marks a significant shift in the ongoing saga. They are now considering either a re-examination by the censor board or continuing the legal battle. This decision moves the focus from a judicial route to an executive solution.

title: 'Just spoke to Virat': Ashwin breaks silence on 'indirect attack' accusation
content: Ravichandran Ashwin and Virat Kohli, long-time teammates, shared a remarkable Test journey, achieving significant milestones together. Despite past reports of differing views on selection, their bond remains strong, as evidenced by a recent interaction where they laughed off fan-driven online rivalries. This highlights the enduring camaraderie between cricketing legends amidst fan-fueled debates.

title: 'Effort to protect Assam’s identity': CM Himanta cites SC to defend 'Miyan' remark
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma defended his controversial remarks on "Miya Muslims," clarifying he referred to illegal Bangladeshi migrants. Citing the Supreme Court on demographic concerns, Sarma stated his aim is to protect Assam's identity and security. Opposition leaders condemned his comments, warning of social disharmony and potential civil unrest.

title: No CCTVs, no lifeguards, no alarms: Screams of Delhi's 6-yr-old boy drowned in systemic failure
content: A six-year-old boy drowned at a Delhi swimming pool on June 13, 2025, due to alleged negligence and lack of basic safety measures. Six months later, his grieving family seeks justice, having moved the Delhi High Court after police filed a case against the pool owner and manager.

title: Australia tour of Pakistan: 'Some guys weren't ready to be here,' Aussie captain reveals
content: Australia captain Mitchell Marsh believes the short turnaround from the BBL final won't hinder his team's readiness for the T20I series against Pakistan. He emphasized that preparation varies for players, with many already focused on the upcoming tri-series and the 2026 T20 World Cup.

title: Delhi horror: 6-year-old girl sexually assaulted; 2 boys held, one absconding
content: A six-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted by three boys, aged nine to sixteen, in northeast Delhi's Bhajanpura. Two boys were apprehended, while the eldest reportedly fled to Bihar. The survivor's family protested the incident, which occurred on January 18th, with the girl returning home injured.

title: ‘I’m ready for reunion': OPS says he is open for AIADMK reunification; EPS rejects re-entry
content: Expelled AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam expressed readiness for factional reunification, challenging TTV Dhinakaran and Edappadi Palaniswami to do the same. He dismissed speculation about joining other parties or contesting under a new banner, emphasizing his focus on restoring cadre rights and testing support in the Lok Sabha polls.

title: LeBron James fires back at critics with blunt Instagram repost
content: Los Angeles Lakers icon LeBron James, in his 23rd NBA season, addressed criticism with a pointed Instagram quote, suggesting it's the cost of not being an idiot.  Despite external opinions, he remains focused on leading the Los Angeles Lakers, especially with Austin Reaves sidelined, consistently contributing significant points as the team pushes for the playoffs.

title: ‘Vague, capable of misuse’: SC stays new UGC rules amid uproar — key quotes
content: A bench of Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi issued notices to the Centre and the UGC on the pleas challenging the regulation. The new UGC regulations, notified on January 23, were challenged by various petitioners as being arbitrary, exclusionary, discriminatory and in violation of the Constitution as well as the University Grants Commission Act, 1956.

title: 'We spent every penny we had': Indian couple spend Rs 15 lakh to reunite with their pet
content: A Hyderabad couple, Divya and John, moved to Australia for work but were heartbroken to leave their golden retriever, Sky, behind. Facing stringent Australian pet import laws and a hefty ₹15 lakh cost, they saved diligently and sent Sky to a quarantine facility in Dubai.

title: Union Budget 2026: Experts warn funding alone won’t future-proof universities
content: India's upcoming Union Budget 2026 is prepared to prioritize the education sector. With global economic shifts and rising international education costs, policymakers are focusing on strengthening domestic capacity. Increased funding, tax support, and skill development are crucial. This will help expand India's education system, adapt to economic changes, and prepare students for future opportunities.

title: 'Ranveer wounded religious sentiments,' says advocate on actor's 'Kantara 2' remark
content: Controversy brews as a formal complaint has been lodged against actor Ranveer Singh for allegedly ridiculing the sacred Daiva tradition of the 'Kantara' film during his appearance at IFFI Goa. Advocate Prashanth Methal asserts that Singh's impersonation and description of a deity as a 'female ghost' has deeply offended religious sentiments.

title: Watch: New video shows Alex Pretti's encounter with ICE officials 11 days before death
content: Recent video footage has surfaced showing Alex Pretti engaged in a heated exchange with immigration officers shortly before his tragic shooting by Border Patrol. The clip captures Pretti approaching federal vehicles, culminating in an altercation that involved the use of tear gas.

title: Nurse kills parents with lethal injection for opposing inter-caste marriage in Telangana
content: A shocking incident in Vikarabad district saw a 25-year-old nurse allegedly murder her parents.  Opposing her inter-caste marriage, she reportedly used her medical expertise to administer a fatal overdose of a muscle relaxant, stolen from her hospital.  Police uncovered the truth after initial reports suggested suicide and shock.

title: Pune: 3 teens lure friend via fake profile of girl, murder him and dump body in river
content: Three 15-year-old boys were detained in Pune for allegedly murdering a peer over a friendship with a girl. The victim was lured to a secluded spot using a fake social media profile and subsequently bludgeoned to death before his body was dumped into the Mula river on Republic Day.

title: Insta post, injection, viral video: Sadhvi Prem Baisa 'suspicious death' triggers protest
content: A 25-year-old religious preacher, Sadhvi Prem Baisa, died after collapsing during fever treatment at her ashram, sparking protests from devotees demanding a thorough investigation. Hours after her death, an Instagram post, described as a suicide note, appeared, referencing a denied 'trial by fire' and seeking justice.

title: Girl misses exam due to delay, railways to pay Rs 9L
content: A young woman has been awarded Rs 9.1 lakh in compensation after a delayed train prevented her from attending a crucial entrance exam in 2018. The district consumer commission found the railways accountable for the two-and-a-half-hour delay, which caused her to miss her BSc biotechnology exam at Lucknow University.

title: Nipah virus can remain dormant for up to 45 days: Doctors reveal why this is dangerous
content: Nipah virus, a deadly zoonotic disease with a 40-75% fatality rate, is causing concern after cases in West Bengal. Spreading from fruit bats to humans via contaminated food or direct contact, it presents with flu-like symptoms before progressing to severe neurological issues like encephalitis and seizures. Currently, no specific treatment or vaccine exists, making early detection and isolation crucial.

title: ‘Vijay is not afraid’: SA Chandrasekhar breaks silence on Jana Nayagan release delay
content: As Jana Nayagan continues to face uncertainty over its theatrical release, filmmaker SA Chandrasekhar, father of Thalapathy Vijay, addressed the repeated delays while speaking to the media earlier in the day. Reacting to the latest legal developments, Chandrasekhar made it clear that Vijay remains undeterred and ready to face every challenge ahead.

title: Rani Kapur Trust Challenge: Delhi HC judge recuses from plea; matter moves to new bench
content: Sunjay Kapur's mother, Rani Kapur, has approached the Delhi High Court challenging the validity of a family trust established in her name. She alleges the trust was fraudulently set up to divert her assets, with provisions benefiting her late son and his wife, Priya Kapur, over her.

title: ‘Why wait?’: Ex-India keeper-batter wants Ishan Kishan in, Sanju Samson out
content: Former India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel advocates for Ishan Kishan to replace Sanju Samson in the fifth and final T20I against New Zealand. Patel believes Kishan, who has impressed on his return, should be given the wicketkeeper-batter role immediately if he is the team's preferred choice for the T20 World Cup.

title: Border 2 box office: Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan film crosses Rs 200 crore mark
content: Sunny Deol's patriotic fervor continues to dominate the box office. 'Border 2' has achieved a massive opening, raking in ₹213 crore in its first week, fueled by strong Republic Day sentiment. While not matching 'Gadar 2's' record-breaking pace, the film's success highlights Deol's enduring appeal, especially in mass centers and single screens.

title: How rupee became a victim of geopolitics & a strategic power gap in 2025: Economic Survey explains
content: The Economic Survey says that it does not hurt to have an undervalued rupee in these times, as it offsets to some extent the impact of higher American tariffs on Indian goods

title: Vihaan joins RCB, fulfills childhood dream: Young star set to play with Kohli
content: Nine-year-old Vihaan Malhotra's dream to play with Virat Kohli has materialised as he was bought by Royal Challengers Bengaluru for Rs 30 lakh in the IPL 2026 auction. The 19-year-old, India's only centurion in the ongoing U-19 World Cup, has transformed into an all-dimensional player, impressing with his batting, bowling, and fielding.

title: Economic Survey 2026: Will India-US trade deal be sealed this year?
content: India's trade talks with the US are nearing completion this year, potentially easing external uncertainties, according to the Economic Survey 2026.  While progress has been slow, concluding these negotiations could boost investor sentiment.  The survey also emphasizes India's need to enhance manufacturing competitiveness to fully leverage trade agreements amidst global economic headwinds.

title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Black box recovered; govt assures time-bound probe
content: The ministry of civil aviation is conducting a swift and transparent investigation into the Learjet 45 aircraft crash that tragically claimed the lives of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and four others. Teams from the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau and Directorate General of Civil Aviation have reached the crash site, and crucial black box data recorders have been recovered.

title: Budget allocations for Kochi draw reactions along political lines
content: Although the allocation of ₹79 crore for the second phase of the Kochi metro’s expansion is welcome, the absence of projects that could energise Kochi’s overall development prospects is disappointing, says Kochi Mayor

title: Congress flags ‘mass, targeted voter deletions’ in Form‑7 misuse, seeks ECI intervention
content: Party leader K.C. Venugopal writes to the Election Commission of India alleging a coordinated effort across States to remove eligible electors, especially from marginalised groups

title: Fetching better prices for oil palm farmers a key priority, says A.P. Agriculture Minister
content: Andhra Pradesh ranks first in India in oil palm acreage, production, and productivity, says Atchannaidu

title: DVAC conducts searches at panchayat office near Arakkonam over irregularities in laying borewells
content: Complainant claims fake bills were attached by private contractors to claim the amount sanctioned for drilling of borewells in four hamlets in the village

title: Children with Type-1 diabetes to get free treatment kits at Tirupattur GH
content: They would be provided free treatment including best insulins in pen-fill cartridges, pain free 4 mm needles, glucometers, 100 glucose strips per month per child, insulin pump therapy, a state-of-the-art gadget

title: Guarantee Utsav in Koppal next month to highlight benefits of schemes
content: District-level implementation of the guarantee schemes reviewed at the J.H. Patel Hall of the Zilla Panchayat in Koppal

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: Plans to provide cashless treatment for accident victims
content: A scheme will be formulated and implemented for providing cashless treatment to road accident victims for first five days. An allocation of ₹15 crore announced for the same

title: India eyes bigger share of global aircraft component manufacturing
content: industry leaders say bridging gaps in skills, capital, certification and infrastructure will be critical if the country is to move beyond being a machining hub

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: Budget reaffirms LDF’s vision of inclusive growth: CM
content: Pinarayi says proposals reaffirm Left Democratic Front government’s long-term vision of transforming the State into a modern, developed middle-income society

title: Woman literary meet in Hubballi tomorrow
content: The Akhila Karnataka Mahila Kannada Sahitya Parishat is organising the conference at Sri Siddharoodha Math in Hubballi

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: Cashew sector gets a total outlay of ₹142 crore
content: ₹56 crore for modernisation of cashew processing factories, ₹41 crore as a revolving fund for the Kerala Cashew Board to ensure seamless distribution of material to public sector processing units

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: State bets big on sports
content: Sports sector has been identified as a high-priority area, with an improved focus on infrastructure development, grassroots participation, talent creation and scientific support

title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Urban land dead capital, must be used well
content: The Survey highlights that land-use restrictions and ambiguity about land titles may be causing urban land to become “dead capital”

title: Naval officer to deliver 25th annual VTU convocation address in Belagavi
content: This is Part 2 of the convocation wherein postgraduate degrees will be awarded, while undergraduate degrees were given away in July 2025

title: Watch: Highlights of Kerala budget 2026
content: With the Assembly elections in Kerala coming up this year, the State finance minister KN Balagopal presented a people-centric budget for 2026. Here are some of the announcements.

title: Kerala Budget 2027-2027: ₹95.85 crore set aside for revenue dept., information bureau proposed
content: The bureau will disseminate information on the department’s services and activities besides monitoring public feedback

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27 raises allocation for Industries sector,  positions State as a hub for critical minerals
content: Increased allocation of ₹122.54 crore from last year to bolster the industrial sector. Key initiatives include a ‘Rare Earth Corridor’ linking Vizhinjam port to Chavara and Kochi, as well as funds for a Defence Technology Innovation Hub and support for micro and small enterprises.

title: Tirumala temple to remain closed due to lunar eclipse on March 3
content: The hill shrine will remain closed from 9 a.m. to 7.30 p.m. and darshan will resume from 8.30 p.m. after the ‘suddhi’ and ‘punyavachanam’ rituals

title: Centre urged to declare Sammakka–Saralamma Jatara a ‘national festival’
content: The government had accorded top priority to the historic tribal festival and undertaken several permanent development works to provide better facilities for devotees, Minister for Revenue Ponguleti Srinivas Reddy said

title: Assam CM cites Supreme Court observations to defend ‘Miya’ remarks
content: The term is locally used in the context of undocumented Bangladeshi Muslim migration, Himanta Biswa Sarma says

title: ‘Vijay Bharat’, other tunes regale audience at Beating Retreat amid ‘Vande Mataram’ spirit
content: Big screens have been installed at the venue, beaming live images of the ceremony. They also carried symbolic images of 150 years of ‘Vande Mataram', the Gaganyaan mission, and ‘Amar Jawan Jyoti’.

title: Ministers Srinivas Reddy, Laxman Kumar inspect arrangements on motorbikes
content: Officials were instructed to ensure zero inconvenience to pilgrims during the peak days of the biennial fair

title: Personal data protection is a major challenge in the digital age, says academic
content: Robert Jose of the Department of English Studies at the Vijayanagara Sri Krishnadevaraya University was speaking after inaugurating a debate competition on campus in Ballari

title: First rake of Vande Bharat coaches undergo maintenance in Tiruchi
content: The defects in seats and passenger-related amenities were repaired and the braking systems and equipment besides pantographs were checked thoroughly

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: Kerala presents an ‘Elderly Budget’ for the first time
content: The Elderly Budget is a new feature that underlines ageing Kerala’s increasing focus on concepts such as ‘silver economy’ and ‘care economy’

title: When Homo sapiens faces the ruins of its own progress
content: Debris Theatre’s physical and visual spectacle Wow at ITFoK turns ecological anxiety into a haunting stage experience

title: Apex mountaineering body teams up with Kolkata company to promote high altitude travel
content: The intention behind the event is to help travellers make informed decisions, and make them feel part of a larger travel community

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: Balagopal warns against ‘venomous communal snakes’ undermining Kerala’s unity
content: Finance  Minister says  unity is Kerala’s greatest guarantor of growth, prosperity, religious harmony and peace, adding we cannot imagine a better factor to attract foreign tourists, entrepreneurs and capital to our State

title: DC nod compulsory to engage child actors in films, TV programmes
content: The requirement is in accordance with the Child Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act, 1986, and its Amendment Act, 2016

title: Watch: State funeral for Ajit Pawar in Baramati
content: The last rites of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, killed in a plane crash, were held with full state honours on Thursday (January 29, 2026) at Baramati in Pune district. Union Ministers Amit Shah, Nitin Gadkari, former Union Minister Sharad Pawar and BJP president Nitin Nabin attended the 66-year-old Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) chief’s funeral at the Vidya Pratishthan ground at Baramati, around 100 km from Pune.

title: BJP, JD(S) accuse Karnataka govt of misusing tax payers’ money for ads on new job scheme
content: BJP and JD(S) objected to advertisements being released by the Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Department, which they termed “illegal.”

title: Israeli Envoy confirms PM Modi's visit, says ‘invitation has been extended’
content: Praising India’s civilisational ethos, Reuven Azars highlighted the country’s long tradition of pluralism and tolerance, noting that Jewish communities in India have historically lived without facing the persecution seen elsewhere

title: Budget is CPI(M)’s manifesto presented in Assembly: BJP
content: Party leader K.K. Surendran describes the Budget as a set of false and unimplementable promises of a caretaker government that lost the people’s mandate in the recent local body elections

title: Economic Survey 2025-26 shows India in bright light in an  increasingly darker world
content: The Economic Survey 2025-26 has upgraded its medium-term outlook for India’s growth to 7%, but has also said it could be impacted by an increasingly grim global outlook

title: Karnataka’s Energy Minister K.J. George denies rumours of resignation
content: The rumour had surfaced following allegations of interference in his Department by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah’s son Yathindra

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: funds set aside for adult immunisation, menopause clinics
content: Medical-care and public-health sector gets ₹2,500.31 crore. ₹50 crore for extending health insurance cover for families outside purview of KASP

title: Yettinahole project: CAG flags irregularities in tendering, financial management
content: The audit pointed out undue financial favour to contractors, including non-recovery of excess costs of pipe materials, extra payments for works already covered under turnkey contracts, and irregular advance payments for pipe supply

title: Trade deals should not damage domestic industries on either side, says World Bank President Ajay Banga
content: On the issue of tariffs leading to a new world order, Mr. Banga says tariff should be seen an opportunity to grow

title: U.S. MNC to set up its unit at Manapparai SIPCOT industrial park
content: Jabil Inc. supplies components to tech giants such as Apple, CISCO, H.P. and Dell; it will invest ₹2,000 crore at Manapparai facility with a potential to employ 5,000 people

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: Medium Term Fiscal Policy statement echoes Kerala’s expectations of better deal from 16th Finance Commission
content: As per Budget Estimates for 2026-27, Union government transfers are projected to grow to ₹68,613.86 crore, with the share of Central taxes and grants-in-aid respectively accounting for ₹42,114.32 crore and ₹26,499.54 crore

title: Andhra Pradesh to establish exclusive women industrial park
content: The agreement provides for the establishment of a 30-acre Women Entrepreneurs’ Industrial Park under the Andhra Pradesh Policy for Establishment of Private Industrial Parks with Plug-and-Play Infrastructure (2024–29)

title: India monitoring reports of attacks against minorities in Bangladesh, says govt.
content: The government said India expects the interim government of Bangladesh to discharge its responsibilities by “thoroughly investigating” these incidents and “bring all perpetrators of killings, arson and violence against minorities to justice without excuses”

title: Delhi court acquits L-G Saxena in 2000 defamation case filed by Medha Patkar
content: In March 2025, the court had dismissed Patkar’s application to examine additional witnesses in the case, terming it a “deliberate attempt to delay the trial, rather than a genuine necessity”

title: Ready to rejoin AIADMK, says O. Panneerselvam

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27 proposes accident/life insurance scheme for school students
content: Total allocation of ₹410.66 crore for midday meal and supplementary nutrition schemes. ₹102.64 crore for continuing inclusion programmes in education sector

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: ₹2,333.64 crore to strengthen food security and price control mechanisms
content: ₹75 crore for market intervention through Consumerfed, ₹95.55 crore for activities of Civil Supplies department related to ration distribution and price regulation

title: Wangchuk denies in SC allegations of remarks about overthrowing govt like Arab Spring
content: Senior advocate Kapil Sibal, appearing for Mr. Wangchuk's wife Gitanjali Angmo, submitted that police have relied on a selective video to mislead the detaining authority

title: Supreme Court reserves verdict on pleas for modification of earlier orders on stray dogs
content: The Supreme Court had earlier flagged its concern over State governments not enhancing their stray dogs sterilisation capacity, saying, "they are all building castles in the air."

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27 earmarks ₹288.60 crore for forestry and wildlife conservation, focus on reducing human-wildlife conflict
content: Installation of smart physical barriers and warning systems, habitat improvement, public awareness programmes and strengthening of Rapid Response Teams and First Response Teams part of measures to check human-wildlife conflicts

title: Three men arrested for sexual assault on woman at government college in Chennai
content: Police said the 20-year-old woman was sexually assaulted by Muthuselvam, who ran a canteen on the college campus, along with Gunasekaran and Karthikeyan

content: Parliament Budget Session 2026 Highlights: Nirmala Sitharaman presented economic survey of India in Lok Sabha today.

title: NCP Leaders' "Courtesy Meet" With Ajit Pawar's Wife Sparks Succession Buzz
content: Hours after the funeral of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar on Thursday, a meeting in Baramati has fuelled talk that the NCP has begun planning its future strategy.

title: Silver Surpasses Rs 4 Lakh Per Kg Mark In Delhi, Gold Hits New Peak
content: Silver prices surpassed the Rs 4 lakh per kilogram mark in the national capital on Thursday, while gold hit a new peak of Rs 1.83 lakh per 10 grams, tracking a sharp rally in global markets and strong investor demand for the safe-haven assets.

title: Who Are Iran's Revolutionary Guards? Feared 'Pasdaran' Set For EU Terror Tag
content: Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps is the ideological army of the Islamic Republic tasked with protecting the revolution from external and domestic threats.

title: Golden Glimmer In Bundelkhand: Locals Find 'Ancient' Coins In Madhya Pradesh
content: All eyes turned to a quiet village near Madhya Pradesh's Khajuraho where old gold-like coins were unearthed in the Rajgarh village.

title: EU To List Iran's Revolutionary Guards As Terror Group With Al Qaeda, Hamas
content: The European Union is set to list the Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps as a terrorist organisation after it killed 6,373 people during the brutal crackdown on protesters, the Vice-President of the European Commission, Kaja Kallas, said.

title: Dramatic Video Shows BJP MLA Being Abused At Temple, Man Arrested
content: A sensational incident has shaken the political circles in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa, with viral footage showing the verbal abuse and attempted assault of Mangawa BJP MLA Narendra Prajapati.

title: India's First-Ever Budget Was Presented In 1860 By This Englishman
content: India is gearing up for the Union Budget 2026, which will be tabled in the Parliament on February 1. The annual exercise takes us back to the long and complex history of the country's budgeting process.

title: Union Budget 2026: A Lookback At Independent India's First Budget In 1947
content: As India gears up for Union Budget 2026, it is worth looking back at where it all began: The country's very first Budget after Independence in 1947.

title: 6-Year-Old Girl Allegedly Gang-Raped By 3 Minors In Delhi
content: A six-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped by three boys, all under the age of 15, in northeast Delhi's Bhajanpura, the police said.

title: Why Railway Budget Was Merged With Union Budget
content: For decades, the Railway Budget had its own special place on India's financial calendar. It was presented separately. This long-standing tradition came to an end in 2017 when the government decided to merge the two budgets.

title: Delhi Court Acquits Lt Governor In Defamation Case Filed By Medha Patkar
content: A court here on Thursday acquitted Delhi Lieutenant Governor V K Saxena in a 25-year-old defamation case filed by activist Medha Patkar, stating that the complainant failed to prove her charges against him.

title: Can The Union Budget Be Amended? Here's What Happens If MPs Want Changes
content: Parliament's 2026 Budget Session is now underway, with members of both Houses assembling on Wednesday.

title: Last Rites By Son, Gun Salute: Emotional Scenes At Funeral Of Ajit Pawar Aide
content: The last rites of Vidip Dilip Jadhav, the personal security officer to Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, were performed early on Thursday at his native village of Taradgaon in Maharashtra's Satna district.

title: Union Budget 2026: The Red Colour And Its Historic Connection With Budget
content: The association between Budget and the colour red traces its origins to historical practices that shaped the visual identity of the budget file.

title: Himanta Sarma's "Trouble Miyas" Remark Sparks Row, Congress's Court Move

title: Google DeepMind Unveils New AI Tool To Understand DNA Mutations
content: Google DeepMind has revealed a new artificial intelligence system, AlphaGenome, which, the researchers say, could help scientists better interpret the human genome and understand how genetic changes affect biology.

title: 'Vijay Is Good Actor, Not Politician': EPS' Swipe At TVK Chief

content: federal law enforcement unsealed criminal charges alleging Blakeney was one of the ringleaders in a u.s. college basketball gambling and game-fixing scandal involving 26 defendants . the indictment alleges Blakeney convinced NCAA players that his other co-conspirators would pay $10,000 to $32,000 in exchange for poor performances, sitting out of or removing themselves from games, and providing information about players' health .

title: 5-year-old arrested by ICE 'depressed and sad' in detention facility
content:
A US Democratic Congressman, Joaquin Castro, shared about his meeting with Liam Conejo Ramos, the five-year-old detained by federal immigration authorities. He said that the kid is showing signs of depression after being held for days in a Texas detention facility. The Texas representative said he spent about 30 minutes with Liam Conejo Ramos and his father, Adrian Conejo Arias, at the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) facility in Dilley, Texas. Castro said the boy was asleep during his visit and that his father told him the child "hasn’t been himself," adding that Liam had been sleeping excessively and appeared "depressed and sad."

Tensions Flare In Minneapolis As ICE Officers Clash With Journalists Amid Political Backlash

In a video post on X, Castro said, "His dad said that he hasn't been himself, that he's been sleeping a lot because he's been depressed and sad, and so Liam actually was not awake during our visit."

title: The art of dealing with Trump: Playing along & hedging - has India cracked the code?
content: This is a challenging time for Australia. Our relationship with the United States has long been a pillar of our security and prosperity. While there has always been a gap between what Australia wanted the US to be and the reality, this is now a chasm. The Trump Administration's approach to global trade and to international norms means it is a different partner than it was It is in the nature of middle powers to try to bind great powers through rules and norms. We don't want to live in a might-makes-right world where great powers hold sway in their spheres of influence

title: ‘We are all on same page’: Tharoor, Rahul put up united front amid rift speculation
content:
NEW DELHI: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Thursday met party president Mallikarjun Kharge and Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi amid speculations of a rift between him and the party leadership. After meeting Rahul Gandhi and Kharge, Tharoor asserted that “all is good” and that he was on the “same page” with the Congress leadership.

'No Rebellion, No Ambition': Shashi Tharoor Sends Unity Signal After Meeting Rahul Gandhi, Kharge

The meeting, held in Kharge’s chamber in the Parliament House complex, lasted for over an hour. “We had a discussion with my two party leaders, the LoP and the Congress president. We had a very good, constructive, positive discussion,” Tharoor wrote in a post on X.
